alert.note: Alert for Elko; Nye; White Pine (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 01 at 9:22AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Active monsoon pattern to bring showers and thunderstorms and the risk of flash flooding to much of central and eastern Nevada through late this week... Increasing monsoon moisture from southern Nevada and southwestern Utah will bring an areal expansion of showers and thunderstorms to portions of central and eastern Nevada through midweek. Wednesday is expected to bring the more widespread showers and thunderstorms to southeastern Elko county including the Ruby Mountains, White Pine county and northeastern Nye county. Isolated flash flooding from heavier thunderstorms is a the primary concern over the next several days but especially Wednesday. Isolated rain amounts of 0.5 to 0.75 inches are possible with the heaviest thunderstorms, accumulating over a relatively short time of an hour or less during the afternoon and early evening hours. Some potential impacts include flash flooding of normally dry streams and arroyos as well as ponding water on roadways or water-covered roadways which would affect travel. Continue to monitor conditions closely and stay tuned for the latest forecasts, watches, and potential warnings.
